4df0ad3e-c734-4369-83c6-0ea618f49dc8.description: The earner recognises the importance and benefits of healthy conflict and demonstrates the skills to practise and engage in healthy conflict with others. The earner has demonstrated how to communicate and listen without hearing attack, how to be curious and demonstrate vulnerability during the conflict. The earner demonstrated a clear understaning of language choices and body language techniques and how to use these to reduce conflict.
4df0ad3e-c734-4369-83c6-0ea618f49dc8.name: Conflict Resolution

badge_template_activities.title: Attendance and active engagement in a two hour workshop on Conflict Resolution presented by Tracy Ward www.traceyward.co
Successfully completed assessment task.

93efba77-d00e-4fad-8efd-2b15a01d4719.description: The earner of this certificate has completed a series of leadership training sessions on topics including teamwork, leadership styles, sacrifice in leadership, resilience, conflict resolution, appreciating diversity and an introduction to Indigenous culture and leadership. The earner has demonstated fundamental knowledge and skills in all the above areas.
93efba77-d00e-4fad-8efd-2b15a01d4719.name: Dunmore Lang College Leadership Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Attendance at six workshops: Working in a Team, Living with Change, Presence and Confidence, Giving and Receiving Feedback, Conflict Resolution and Two Seconds Ahead. These workshops are intended to provide the earner with a fundamental understanding and skills in leadership of others and themselves.
Successfully completed assessments in the six different elements of the course.

skills.name: Embracing Diversity And Working Within Different Value Systems

6701c31f-d21c-4c9c-8404-c371459efce3.description: The earner developed a practical understanding of different team roles, their application within high-performance teams, different teamwork models and their relevance to team-based activities. They have completed a detailed online profile and received feedback from at least four observers on team roles they commonly display and subsequently workshopped this learning to build understanding. This self-awareness will enable them to understand and successfully manage behavioural dynamics in a team.
6701c31f-d21c-4c9c-8404-c371459efce3.name: Working in a Team

badge_template_activities.title: Completed an online self-assessment of Belbin© Team Roles
Coordinated Observer profiling by four colleagues of current performance in a team

Completed a two-hour workshop presented by Roger Norton of Norton Crumlin & Associates including presentation of results, small group debriefs discussion and personal action planning for their next team-based activity
Successfully completed an assessment

skills.name: Ability To Recognize And Develop One's Own Leadership Style
Understanding And Application Of Belbin Team Roles

56800b9e-33e2-4089-88a3-cd5fb5f30f26.description: The earner of this credential has demonstrated an understanding of the skills required to build and lead more resilient, resourceful and supportive teams. The earner has an understanding of the importance of self-management, supporting diverse groups of people and fostering a culture of trust, understanding and curiosity.
56800b9e-33e2-4089-88a3-cd5fb5f30f26.name: Resilient Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: Attendance and active participation in Resilience Leadership session presented by Daniel Murray of Empathic Consulting
Successfully completed assessment on course.

da83e92b-3c59-4945-9254-96e13169747a.description: The earner of this credential has demonstrated an understanding of leadership , character development and growing their leadership capacity. The earner recognised leveraging leadership, conflict resolution methods, accountability, the importance of mentors, personal conflict preferences, empathy, accountability and personal sacrifice in leadership.
da83e92b-3c59-4945-9254-96e13169747a.name: Leadership 101

badge_template_activities.title: Attendance and active engagement in full-day workshop presented by Miles Paludin of Miles Padudin Consulting.
Successfully completed an assessment

c20599ec-c8e8-498b-9822-2f62f5bec3eb.description: The earner of this credential has demonstrated an understanding of the key challenges encountered when building connection and understanding in groups. The earner learned the importance and role of emotional drivers to develop broader perspectives as well as skills in developing empathy and inspiring curiosity in others. The earner has demonstrated the ability to step outside their own perspective and explore alternative views.
c20599ec-c8e8-498b-9822-2f62f5bec3eb.name: Leading with Emotional Intelligence

badge_template_activities.title: Attendance and activie participation in Leading with Emotional Intelligence Seminar presented by Daniel Murray of Empathic Consulting
Worked in groups to develop a Perspective Taking Map
Successfully completed assessment.

skills.name: Understanding Stress Reactions In Self And Others

8c1eb1a2-3115-40b0-a7f8-29da3d7292a8.description: The earner of this credential has obtained an introductory understanding of Australian Indigenous communities, basic cultural structures and histories. They have an understanding of fundamental social and cultural issues that Indigenous Australians face when operating in a modern, Western society. This credential does not make the earner an expert on topics covered, but has provided them with an understanding of how to lead alongside Indigenous peoples in Western organisations and communities.
8c1eb1a2-3115-40b0-a7f8-29da3d7292a8.name: Manawari Cultural Safety Training 2022

badge_template_activities.title: Attendance at a 2 hour seminar and participation in group work presented by Ben Kitchener.
Successful completion of an assessment based on the Cultural Competency seminar.

skills.name: Basic Introduction To Impacts Of Colonialism
Insight Into Effect Of Government Policies
Insight Into Impact Of Systemic Injustice
Introduction To Indigenous Communities And Cultural Structures

207a65cd-6687-46d2-a5fd-e938d31577eb.description: The earner has demonstrated knowledge of, and skills in, giving and receiving feedback in a way that is situationally appropriate and effective and is able to apply them and lead others in doing the same. They have understood and applied several models to support the process of giving and receiving feedback and are able to navigate normal reticence to do so. The course emphasises the importance of providing balanced feedback where reinforcing feedback is as important as corrective feedback.
207a65cd-6687-46d2-a5fd-e938d31577eb.name: Giving and Receiving Feedback

badge_template_activities.title: Attend 'Giving and Receiving Feedback' Seminar and successfully complete assessment.

fa262ae8-bfb7-4672-90a8-a0c8f24be641.description: The earner of this credential recognises the role of managing their own mind to create the conditions for more wise, compassionate leadership as a Resident Adviser. They have demonstrated an understanding of the key elements of creating trust, observed the myth of mental multi-tasking and the power of choosing their focus. They have practised mindful communication and recognise the impact of being fully present for others. Presenter Gillian Coutts, Country Director Potential Project Australia
fa262ae8-bfb7-4672-90a8-a0c8f24be641.name: Two Seconds Ahead

badge_template_activities.title: Participants completed five and a half hours of work shop activities and successfully completing an assessment piece.

c1a11c55-8db4-48e1-9514-f26ea4b9d287.description: The earner of this credential has demonstrated an understanding of values and assumptions that inform their worldviews and visions for the future as well as insights into relationship-centred approaches to leadership and problem-solving informed by Indigenous governance. The earner is equipped with new approaches to a rapidly changing social, political and environmental climate and demonstrated critical and collaborative thinking skills to address real world issues.
c1a11c55-8db4-48e1-9514-f26ea4b9d287.name: Living with Change

badge_template_activities.title: Attendance at the workshop and successful completion of an assessment piece. Presented by Ms Madi Day, Lecturer, Macquarie University

9213cff8-7a86-4058-8967-acef682c7f13.description: The earner understands emotional intelligence principles and how to apply them in the workplace to build good relationships. The earner knows the importance of making first impressions, how to connect quickly with people, the power of concise clear messaging and how to eliminate redundant and diminishing language in their own communication. The earner practised and demonstrated all of these skills in the workshop and can confidently communicate within an organisation.
9213cff8-7a86-4058-8967-acef682c7f13.name: Presence and Confidence - Creating Great First Impressions

badge_template_activities.title: Attendance at six out of the following workshops: Working in Teams, Mastering Courageous Conversations, Leadership through Honest Feedback, Two Seconds Ahead, Hiddens Secrets of Communication, Manawari Cultural Safety Training, Diversity and Difference, and Mental Health Awareness. These workshops are intended to provide the earner with a fundamental understanding of leadership and how to be a good leader.
Successfully completed assessments in the six different elements of the course.

skills.name: Embracing Diversity And Working Within Different Value Systems

28a98484-15a5-4022-886f-b10a5022d489.description: The earner completed a thorough analysis of Patrick Lencioni’s book, “The 5 Dysfunctions of a Team” enabling them to determine the differences between a healthy high performing and dysfunctional teams. The earner discussed the effects of the absence of trust, fear of conflict, lack of commitment, avoidance of accountability and inattention to results, has on creating a dysfunctional team. The earner brainstorm solutions for the 5 dysfunctions and planned a strategy for creating functional teams.
28a98484-15a5-4022-886f-b10a5022d489.name: Five Dysfunctions of a Team

badge_template_activities.title: The earner attended a three hour workshop.

2544285c-7bb4-471e-9317-2e902c4fa9f2.description: The earner understands emotional intelligence principles and how to apply them in the workplace to build good relationships. The earner knows the importance of making first impressions, how to connect quickly with people, the power of concise clear messaging and how to eliminate redundant and diminishing language in their own communication. The earner practised and demonstrated all of these skills in the workshop and can confidently communicate within an organisation.
2544285c-7bb4-471e-9317-2e902c4fa9f2.name: Hidden Secrets of Communication 2022

8f8ee1f3-fe15-446e-8d2b-1f486ed0bbc5.description: The earner understands the importance of emotional intelligence in building relationships. The earner understands the four communication profiles, when to use them in the workplace, how to spot the dominant profiles in others, connect with different profiles via face to face, phone or email communications. The earner demonstrated these skills in the workshop making the earner a powerful communicator in the workplace able to proficiently communicate with all colleagues and clients.
8f8ee1f3-fe15-446e-8d2b-1f486ed0bbc5.name: IGETU

badge_template_activities.title: Attend two hour workshop with Tracey Ward.
